hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout Following Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: When the market is in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence >60%) and BTC's 20-day realized volatility falls below its 60-day rolling 20th percentile, a breakout above the 20-day Bollinger Band (2σ) within the next 5 days will signal a transition to a BULL regime with 70% probability, generating positive alpha over the subsequent 10 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended periods of low volatility in neutral markets often precede significant directional moves. A high-volume breakout from compression suggests institutional accumulation and regime change initiation.
entry_conditions: BTC 20-day realized volatility < 20th percentile of its 60-day rolling window
BTC price closes above upper 20-day Bollinger Band (2σ)
Volume on breakout day > 1.5x 20-day average volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: 10% gain from entry or regime shifts to BULL with confidence > 75%
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 5% loss from entry or regime reverts to NEUTRAL/BEAR

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout success rate < 55% or average 10-day return after breakout < 2% over 50+ instances.
